Hi Finn,

The Cogapp ones need to go back to Cogapp, I am not saying that to simply pass the buck here, but if you want to make changes to the CSS it makes sense to get the person who coded the CSS to make the change (as they will have a full understanding of what styles are applied to which classes). These change may appear trivial (and indeed it may be trivial). But we have had several cases recently where we have spent a disappropriate amount of time trying to make what were initially seemingly small CSS or JS tweaks (for example we change a CSS style for the home page and then find out that it's causes another link to turn blue elsewhere on IE7 for some odd reason and spend a day debugging it while up against a deadline). As we haven't started coding the site in earnest yet it seems to make sense to get the HTML/CSS as you want it before we start implementing it. My concern is that if we try and make changes and then at the last minute someone spots that that is throwing up a issue we'll be trying to fix them issue just prior to launch.

- HREF: the caption isn't a link, if we make it a link it gets the wrong style (see above)

- H2 Headlines: Doable but need CogApp to update the CSS as they currently turn blue when made links (unless this is what you want) (see screenshot)

- Nav /News nav: exactly the text wraps but maybe not the way you expect (see screenshots). If your OK with the way it looks (and maybe that was how it was designed) then there is no problem.

- Sponsors: if you want four sponsors on the left you'll hit an issue with the fourth one overlaying the background (see screenshot - issues with Sainsbury logo) - solution: get Cogapp to make the middle image smaller?

- Sponsors right: The images don't naturally align right, see attached screenshot:  solution: get Cogapp to make the right hand side images align right (if less than 3) or assign a blank image to unused spots.

- Sponsors right text: can we get Cogapp to add this extra text box in if they are making the above changes (the text box is easy, getting it to always align right can be tricky or may require more than just an align:right tag)

- "News: need to decide on best way to get images that fit" I what Danny is referring to is how images are assigned re. the layout of then news page and whether you are expecting those elements (images/pull quotes) to flow 'in line' or if you want the layout fixed exactly as it is in the design. The downside to using inline images is that the images will have to be resized manually, you may hit issues with getting the exact layout you expect exactly right (depending on content length) and you can't have pull quotes. The downside to having a fixed layout is that it will be fixed and made up of multiple text boxes (although on thsi site that may be the preferable option).

All the rest sounds fine.

thanks

Jamie

Jamie, all clear and really helpful, ta. Will get in touch with Cogapp today and see what we can get done and when.

Hello

We are getting a lot of pressure internally to review the way in which the Travel Advice to Business (TAB) sign-up process works. https://www.london2012.com/settings/login.php?reason=businessProfile This is driven by a usability audit on the TAB section - comments on the sign up process attached.

I know we have discussed this previously but can you remind me of the technical reasons for not having a separate TAB sign up form? My feeling is now that it might be preferable to do this and just hold the data in a completely separate place to the rest of our user management data - how complicated would this be to do in terms of time and cost?

There are some specific recommendations on the doc which would be good to implement but we can take a view on the relevance of those based on the feasibility of having a completely separate form.

Grateful for your thoughts!

Morag

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000
Marking as high.

Hi Danny

Did you manage to speak to Jamie re: the conversation we had around tweaks to the TAB sign up process i.e. making Personal information disappear from the page, and presenting another message at the top of the page.

Morag
Morag, we did talk about it but I am getting the impression that this might be increasingly urgent. Let me get back to you tomorrow with a timescale.
Thank you – that would be great.
Morag, some of these issues might need a wider discussion of how you want registration to work, but we will spend half a day this week to look at them and pick the low hanging fruit.

Hi Danny

Can you let me know which issues you are going to focus on? I need to advise the internal client who is expecting all their problems to be solved by next Thurs...

Hi Morag, I know this is not quite what you want to hear, but quick responses to the main points below. We are really quite keen to look at the wider issues around registration that the usability audit has brought up, but I don't think we can get this all resolved by next week.

1. "Rather than use bullets [radio buttons] to determine between new and existing account holders, split the two options up clearly as shown in the example below".
This looks like a sensible suggestion that is relevant to all classes of users and could probably be implemented relatively simply. Should be doable by next Thursday.

2. "Make this form specific to TAB updates and provide a more general email update form accessed from the global navigation"
This would require us to build and maintain two forms and with them all the associated code that checks the input, returns users to the correct page and updates the user database. We also need to work out what to do with returning users and which form to redirect them to for updating their details--if indeed you still want that functionality. this is not a short piece of work and should probably not be implemented before we have a wider review of the way registration works. Unlikely to be done by next week.

3. "Only include essential fields, this form should be about signing up for travel advice so collect only the required data to return this information"
We could make certain fields optional, but we could not easily make them optional in one context and compulsory in another--at least not without a bit of re-factoring and possibly a separation of forms as mooted above. So, if the change is universal, we can do that before next week; if it is specific to business users, then we almost certainly cannot.

4. "As the users will predominantly be from UK companies, ensure this is at the top of the list"
This looks pretty trivial. before next week, I would hope.

5. "It is anticipated that most users will not be leaving blog posts so create a separate form for those wishing to do so"
Quite so. This is true for non-business users, too. Wider discussion needed. Probably not fixable for next week.

6. "Ensure the form complies with W3C accessibility guidelines and is fully supporting of navigation via tabbing"
This is an issue for all users, not just business users. It would likely need a significant re-working of the form. Not for next week, I think.

If you are in agreement, I suggest we prepare some recommendations for registration which we think might resolve these problems and others, for all site users. See #3454.

Requests for next week:
- Different text for TAB users on both the login and the registration pages
- Remove the "contact information", "about you" and "mailing list" section entirely for TAB users
- remove postcode (as in user[postcode] as opposed to user[postcode]) as a required field.

Login page
Change header to “Login / Sign up”
Instructional copy to read:
“As well as sporting action and excitement across the UK, the London 2012 Games will present new challenges for your business. Start planning now to ensure you can keep running effectively in summer 2012. Get email updates with advice on how to prepare your business for the London 2012 Games.”
 
Registration page
Instructional copy to read:
“As well as sporting action and excitement across the UK, the London 2012 Games will present new challenges for your business. Start planning now to ensure you can keep running effectively in summer 2012. Get email updates with advice on how to prepare your business for the London 2012 Games.”

Hi Danny

Please can you give me an update on this piece of work?

Morag
Now a priority and due to be addressed next week.

Jamie says main things are:
- default to UK
- text at top to change if businessProfile flag set
- hide requirement for normal 'postcode' if businessProfile flag set (in fact hide all fields bar the key ones at the top ie. email/first/last name)
- hide other fields if business (ie. normal uses shouldn't see business fields ever)
- business fields should only show if reason= businessProfile and/or a key field on the businessProfile is populated
Danny's Apr-08 2011 07:35 pm changes are done; now changing behaviour on the actual form.

Various small amendments applied:

comments.value: From Andy: "A quick question - do we have a feeling for how many registrations per hour/day we can handle on the website?  We will be pushing everyone who completes a torchbearer nomination to register to receive email updates, and we’re hoping to receive about 500,000 nominations (possibly greater than a million) over a 6 week period.  So, assuming a flat distribution and 50% of people continue to sign up, we’d be looking at approx 6,000 per day.  Of course that’d probably be greater early on in the process, tailing off over time."

Andy just brought this up again. He is pretty sure that they do not want to batch requests. I think mainly because they want to offer it as an option to people who sign up for Torch nominations rather than making it compulsory. Is there any chance we could do some sort of testing to get some idea of what sort of volume we can cope with?
Closing.

Hi Lars, RSVP that you've seen this and have started work please?

Here are some things we'll need fixing at the very first opportunity please. The sites are 99% populated with images and content but there's still the odd thing here and there that's going wrong with the templates and it's stopping us sending previews to sports managers who are expecting them today

- Please see my reply to Danny's email re: the sponsor / IF logo space in the footer. That one's quite urgent.

- Homepage includes are showing up in sports' Homepage preview view for some sports but not all. E.g. if you preview Basketball homepage you'll see two includes appear and are working fine. The same folder structure is in place for e.g. Beach Volleyball and BMX but the populated includes do not appear in Homepage preview for those sports.

- Has the functionality been built for us to determine which pages appear in the bottom left of the footer yet? I think this was something that was going to be added to metadata on pages? - Some sections of various templates that are populated with text are not appearing in preview. See the Spectator Info template in Basketball as an example. The depth of the white space between different populated sections of the Content template can be halved I think.

description:
Hi Lars, RSVP that you've seen this and have started work please?

Here are some things we'll need fixing at the very first opportunity please. The sites are 99% populated with images and content but there's still the odd thing here and there that's going wrong with the templates and it's stopping us sending previews to sports managers who are expecting them today

- Please see my reply to Danny's email re: the sponsor / IF logo space in the footer. That one's quite urgent.

- Homepage includes are showing up in sports' Homepage preview view for some sports but not all. E.g. if you preview Basketball homepage you'll see two includes appear and are working fine. The same folder structure is in place for e.g. Beach Volleyball and BMX but the populated includes do not appear in Homepage preview for those sports.

- Has the functionality been built for us to determine which pages appear in the bottom left of the footer yet? I think this was something that was going to be added to metadata on pages? There are currently a couple of 'lorem ipsum' links in the footers that will need to either be changed or removed according to whether they're necessary for each sport

- Some sections of various templates that are populated with text are not appearing in preview. See Spectator Info (Content) page for Beach Volleyball as an example - entire section from 'Tickets' heading to 'Contact us' heading isn't appearing. Also occuring on Homepage template for Equestrian, all text in main body of page disappears in preview.

- This is something that I know you wanted to leave to the last minute, but the white gaps between different sections of the content template could do with shortening when you're ready please. See the Spectator Info template in Basketball as an example. The depth of the white space between different populated sections of the Content template can be halved I think.

- All bulletpoints should appear as bullets rather than dashes please?

- A quick heads-up: we'll need to change the copyright text in the bottom right hand corner in the footer once we had it. Will send that through as soon as we get it

comments.value: It would be very useful if, in particular, the homepage takeover rules could be kept separate from the Short URLs, in order to prevent accidental publication of splash pages &c.

Technical solution: add it to the php of the hompage:

put the redirect into the homepage?
if (-f "/path/to/.homepage-takeover") {
 read value (read first line that doesn't start with a "#").
 if there's such a line AND IF %{HTTP_REFERER} !^http(s)?://(www\.)?(our)?london2012.com/.*$ [NC]
  redirect to value from file
}

The procedure for launching splash page is then:
Edit .homepage-takeover:
 /path/to/splashpage.html
(add a leading "#" to disable it).

Instructions for ITS will need to be amended, as it is:
 .homepage-takeover
whose promotion from staging -> live will need to be disabled during testing.

NB  .homepage-takeover should be in the CMS.

Jamie, not sure whether you'll see this as you're only Cc-ed. But ... does the above look like a reasonable approach? i.e. to serve the homepage via php, rather than apache. It has the potential to be slightly heavier on the webserver boxes but ... we do have 6 of them!

i.e. at present, when we do a homepage takeover, Apache sends the redirect without having to spawn a php process. This new system will mean the php page has to be parsed on each request (I've done a brief experiment and it appears that the php parser parses the whole file, even if you send a redirect right at the top).

Hi Morag,
Have attached effort estimate of 2 days.
Actual days might be less (but won't exceed 2).
Can start this work as soon as / if you okay it.
Kieran

HI Morag,
With another splash launch due tomorrow, I hope you don't mind me reminding you about this ticket/proposal!
Kieran

Apols, it got lost in my inbox.

I am happy with this piece of work – please proceed.

Morag

In progress.
Should be in place by end of Tuesday.
Kieran

Hi Morag,
This behaviour is now deployed.
Are you aware of any splash page requirements in the next couple of weeks?
I'm just thinking it would be good to test this "in the wild" before I close this ticket.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

Great. No, we don’t have any splash pages for a while – in fact, don’t think we will have another until we do Paralympic tickets in September.

So not sure how you will get to test it just now. ☹

Morag

Ok, well I'm marking it as closed.
I will attach some documentation to this ticket, however relevant staff at Kitsite are all aware of the new procedure.


===== DOCUMENTATION =====
Enabling/disabling splash page:

    * Edit this page (http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/includes/homepage-takeover.php) in the CMS.
    * There is a hyperlink container named "splashPage". Whatever this fragment links to will become the "splash page". i.e. you should use the "link" tool to pick the whatever page or asset you want the splash page to be. NB It can even be a link to an external website (just enter the url into the link picker).
    * Once you've chosen the splash destination, save and publish homepage-takeover.php.
    * As soon as this page goes live, the homepage will redirect to the splash page.
    * Removing: To remove the splash page redirect, edit the page again in the CMS (http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/includes/homepage-takeover.php) and use the (X) tool to remove the link assigned to the "splashPage" container.
      Publish homepage-takeover.php. Once it is live, the homepage takeover will disappear.
    * Staging/rsync: If (once the functionality is fully-live) you want to test on staging before going live, you will need to specify the following rule in .rsync-filter
      - includes/homepage-takeover.php

Ah i think this is all sorted! Will close, reopen if necessary! Thanks

Oh sry, i thought you wanted to have a header image on the homepage? 

( http://londonprepares.kitsite.com/kit/preview/index.html )

1) Katherine and I have used the 'Hub' template to create a homepage, here:

http://londonprepares.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test.html
I think it needs a header and footer though and I don't have access to add those myself. Can we put one in the root folder, will that work?

---- 

Think its an misunderstanding. But in case you'd want to give the homepage a header you can now :)

Ah I see, that was about it completely lacking a header and footer, rather than a header image specifically. Danny put some includes in the root folder so that one was fixed.

Quick request while I have you – the only other thing related to the header that we wanted to sort was to make the ‘London Prepares series’ in the header on every site hyperlinked to go back to www.londonpreparesseries.comhttp://www.londonpreparesseries.com . Is that doable with much ease?
Shouldn't be a problem, lets see
Ok interestingly it was a bit of a problem, its not anymore but i will need to republish the whole site, is that ok?
Think we're done :)
Good stuff, did you publish already?
Oh yes, i did, i only published pages that were published before so i thought it was safe!
Hey, that’s ok, looks dandy. Thanks again.
I think this can be closed?
